title: Program Catalog Mechanical Engineering
slu_vision_mission: We envision Saint Louis University as an excellent missionary and transformative educational institution zealous in developing locally responsive, globally competitive, and empowered human resources who are creative, competent, socially involved, and imbued with Christian spirit.
school_vision_mission: The School of Engineering and Architecture (SEA) envisions herself as an exemplary educational institution for engineering and architecture dedicated to elevating instruction, research, and extension to a higher level of competence and creativity committed to shaping the socio-technical environment founded on Christian values.
educational_objectives: Demonstrate technical competence in solving and designing engineering systems while considering technical, societal, economic, and ethical dimensions.
Practice their profession guided by Christian tenets of honesty, service, dedication, and moral responsibility.
Pursue advanced studies, research, and other creative endeavors in science and technology.
Contribute to social, technical, and business challenges vital to national progress.
learning_outcomes: Apply knowledge of math, science, and engineering to solve complex engineering problems.
Conduct investigations using research-based methods and data analysis.
Design systems and components that meet specified needs considering public health, safety, and the environment.
Function effectively as individuals and team members in multidisciplinary environments.
Analyze engineering problems and formulate conclusions using first principles and literature review.
Practice professional ethics and adhere to norms of engineering practice.
Communicate effectively with the engineering community and society.
Evaluate the societal and environmental impact of engineering solutions.
Engage in lifelong learning and adapt to technological changes.
Understand societal, legal, and cultural issues related to engineering practice.
Use modern tools and techniques with an understanding of their limitations.
Apply management and economic principles in project handling and team leadership.
Practice Christian values in personal and professional endeavors in line with the CICM mission.

admission_policies.freshmen: Must pass the SLU College Entrance Exam (SLU-CEE), exams held mid-October to mid-December. Admission starts mid-April.
admission_policies.transferees: Allowed in all programs except BS Medical Laboratory Science. Must pass Qualifying Exam, then Personality Test and Interview. Foreign transferees must pass English Proficiency Test (EPT).
admission_policies.graduate_students: For Master’s: must hold a relevant Baccalaureate degree. For Doctorate: must hold a relevant Master’s degree.
foreign_students: Must apply at least 6 months before start of term.
Must be in Baguio 4 weeks before term starts for EPT, SLU-CEE/QE/GPEE, Personality Test.
Must pass all entrance and proficiency exams.
Must undergo Preadmission at Student Affairs Office.
Must secure a valid Student Visa.

tuition_and_fees.note: Per semester, AY 2022–2023, subject to change
